name: Component.RadState

classitems.description: Sets the {{c-l state}} property to false. This action is now deprecated as of Ember Radical 1.6 and will be removed in Ember Radical 2.0. you should use {{c-l actions.setFalse}} instead.
classitems.name: close

classitems.description: Sets the {{c-l state}} property to true. This action is now deprecated as of Ember Radical 1.6 and will be removed in Ember Radical 2.0. you should use {{c-l actions.setTrue}} instead.
classitems.name: open

classitems.description: Boolean state tracking property. Use this to handle show/hide status or any arbitrary state that can be represented by a boolean.
classitems.name: state

classitems.description: Rad State is a purely functional component with no rendered output of its own, so it doesn't need a root element cluttering up the DOM when it's being used.
classitems.name: tagName

classitems.description: Toggles the value of {{c-l 'state'}} to the opposite of its current value.
classitems.name: toggleState

description:
Component that can be used for tracking state changes with modals or drawers. Wrap either in one of these and use the yielded state and actions to handle showing/hiding/controlling your component.

Useful mainly for demonstration/documentation purposes, but also handy for when you don't have a convenient place to store state (particularly during early development stages). It's also kind of nice for not cluttering up your parent scope with a bunch of extra state and actions you might not want to hang onto. Go nuts!

Usage

Instances of rad-state yield a {{c-l state}} property and a hash of actions for manipulating that state: {{c-l setTrue}}, {{c-l setFalse}}, and {{c-l toggleState}}.

{{#rad-state as |state stateActions|}}
  {{bank-vault
    isOpen=state
    closeVault=stateActions.setFalse
    openVault=stateActions.setTrue}}
{{/rad-state}}

Or for a smipler toggling implementation:

{{#rad-state as |switchState switchActions|}}
  {{light-switch isOn=switchState toggleSwitch=switchActions.toggleState}}
{{/rad-state}}

The actions in the actions hash have already been yielded via the action helper, so it is not necessary to continue using that helper when passing actions into child components as properties (but you totally still can if you would prefer to.

method.description: Sets the {{c-l state}} property to false. This action is now deprecated as of Ember Radical 1.6 and will be removed in Ember Radical 2.0. you should use {{c-l actions.setFalse}} instead.
method.name: close

method.name: open

method.description: Toggles the value of {{c-l 'state'}} to the opposite of its current value.
method.name: toggleState

property.description: Boolean state tracking property. Use this to handle show/hide status or any arbitrary state that can be represented by a boolean.
property.name: state

property.description: Rad State is a purely functional component with no rendered output of its own, so it doesn't need a root element cluttering up the DOM when it's being used.
